info.title: Nivio Input Models
info.description: The models used to generated landscapes and their components.

mapStylesheet.description: A resolvable URL pointing to a CSS stylesheet. This stylesheet is included in the generated SVG map. Use is to style the appearance of the map.

mapLogo.description: A resolvable URL pointing to an image. This image is included (embedded as data-url) in the generated SVG map.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the group (also used as name). Descriptions are merged based on the identifier.

owner.description: The business owner of the group.

color.description: The HTML (hexcode only!) color used to draw the group and its items. If no color is given, one is computed.

contains.description: A list of item identifiers or SQL-like queries to easily assign items to this group.

items.description: A list of item identifiers or SQL-like queries to easily assign items to this group.

links.description: Key-value pairs of related links. Some keys like 'github' cause that the endpoint data is parsed and added to to corresponding landscape component.

GroupDescription.description: A group of items. Could be used as bounded context, for instance.

protection.description: A description of the interface protection method.

InterfaceDescription.description: Describes a low-level interface of an item.

additionalProperties.description: Key-value pair labels for an item.

labels.description: Key-value pair labels for an item.

identifier.description: Immutable unique identifier (maybe use an URN). Primary means to identify items in searches.

name.description: A human readable name/title. The name is considered when items are searched.

owner.description: The business owner of the item. Preferably use an email address.

contact.description: The primary way to contact a responsible person or team. Preferably use an email address.

group.description: The identifier of the group this item belongs in. Every item requires to be member of a group internally, so if nothing is given, the value is set to common.

interfaces.description: A collection of low level interfaces. Can be used to describe HTTP API endpoints for instance.

providedBy.description: A collection of identifiers which are providers for this item (i.e. hard dependencies that are required). This is a convenience field to build relations.

items.description: A collection of identifiers which are providers for this item (i.e. hard dependencies that are required). This is a convenience field to build relations.

icon.description: An icon name or URL to set the displayed map icon. The default icon set is https://materialdesignicons.com/ and all names can be used (aliases do not work).

color.description: Overrides the group color. Use an HTML hex color code without the leading hash.

address.description: The technical address of the item (should be an URI). Taken into account when matching relation endpoints.

type.description: The type of the item. A string describing its nature. If no icon is set, the type determines the displayed icon.

lifecycle.description: The lifecycle state of an item.

status.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

additionalProperties.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

items.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

statuses.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

additionalProperties.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

items.description: A list of statuses that works like hardcoded KPIs.

additionalProperties.description: The parts used to create the item. Usually refers to technical frameworks.

frameworks.description: The parts used to create the item. Usually refers to technical frameworks.

links.description: Key-value pairs of related links. Some keys like 'github' cause that the endpoint data is parsed and added to to corresponding landscape component.

ItemDescription.description: List of configuration sources. Handled in the given order, latter extend/overwrite earlier values like items etc.

description.description: Description of the purpose of the KPI

label.description: Key of the label to evaluate

additionalProperties.description: A map of number based ranges that determine the resulting status (GREEN|YELLOW|ORANGE|RED|BROWN). Use a semicolon to separate upper and lower bounds. Tries to evaluate label values as numbers.

ranges.description: A map of number based ranges that determine the resulting status (GREEN|YELLOW|ORANGE|RED|BROWN). Use a semicolon to separate upper and lower bounds. Tries to evaluate label values as numbers.

additionalProperties.description: A map of string based matchers that determine the resulting status (GREEN|YELLOW|ORANGE|RED|BROWN). Use a semicolon to separate matchers.

matches.description: A map of string based matchers that determine the resulting status (GREEN|YELLOW|ORANGE|RED|BROWN). Use a semicolon to separate matchers.

enabled.description: A flag indicating that the KPI is active. Can be used to disable default kpis.

KPIConfig.description: The configuration of landscape specific key performance indicators that derive status information from landscape components. Usually the KPIs work on labels

greedy.description: Flag that enables instant creation items based relation targets that cannot be found in the sources.

groupBlacklist.description: Names or patterns of groups that should be excluded from the landscape. Used to improve automatic scanning results.

items.description: Names or patterns of groups that should be excluded from the landscape. Used to improve automatic scanning results.

labelBlacklist.description: Names or patterns of labels that should be ignored. Used to improve automatic scanning results.

items.description: Names or patterns of labels that should be ignored. Used to improve automatic scanning results.

kpis.description: Key performance indicator configs. Each KPI must have a unique identifier.

LandscapeConfig.description: Configuration of key performance indicators (i.e. status indicators) and layouting tweaks.

identifier.description: Immutable unique identifier. Maybe use an URN.

contact.description: Primary contact method, preferably an email address.

description.description: A brief description of the landscape.

owner.description: The business owner (person or team), preferably an email address.

templates.description: Item descriptions to be used as templates. All values except identifier and name will be applied to the assigned items.

groups.description: Description of item groups (optional, can also be given in sources).

items.description: List of configuration sources. Handled in the given order, latter extend/overwrite earlier values like items etc.

partial.description: marks that the landscape is not complete, but an update

links.description: Key-value pairs of related links. Some keys like 'github' cause that the endpoint data is parsed and added to to corresponding landscape component.

maxIterations.description: The maximum number of iterations. More iterations theoretically lead to better results.

forceConstantFactor.description: A factor to influence the attracting and repulsive forces in a layout.

maxDistanceLimitFactor.description: A factor to influence maximum distance where forces are applied.

minDistanceLimitFactor.description: A factor to influence minimum distance where forces are applied.

deprecation.description: deprecation info (typically used in OpenAPI specs)

Link.description: A link to an external resource. Contains a href (URL) plus various attributes for authentication and/or hateoas.

deprecation.description: deprecation info (typically used in OpenAPI specs)

url.description: A URL, but can also be a relative path.

additionalProperties.description: A map with template identifier as key and item identifier matchers as value

items.description: A map with template identifier as key and item identifier matchers as value

assignTemplates.description: A map with template identifier as key and item identifier matchers as value

SourceReference.description: This is a reference to a configuration file.
